report_title: Commercial Cleaning & Sanitation Services in the US
executive_summary: While the pandemic forced many businesses and facilities to close down, those deemed essential remained open. These businesses were subjected to increased health and safety regulations and relied on commercial cleaning and sanitation services to maintain cleanliness.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Health and Safety Regulations Increase Amid the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While the pandemic forced many businesses and facilities to close down, those deemed essential remained open. These businesses were subjected to increased health and safety regulations and relied on commercial cleaning and sanitation services to maintain cleanliness.
Through the end of 2024, commercial cleaning and sanitation services revenue is expected to swell at a CAGR of 1.0%, reaching $75.3 billion, including a stagnation in 2024.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Janitorial Services Enter the Technological Age
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Technological advances are expected to impact cleaning services, making them less labor-intensive. Examples of such technology include disinfectant-spraying drones and robots that can clean building exteriors and exterior windows.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Ecofriendly Cleaning Products Will Be a Point of Emphasis
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising environmental concerns will push cleaning services to use eco-friendly products. New environmentally friendly cleaning products can match the effectiveness of traditional cleansers without the inclusion of harmful chemicals.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide cleaning, sanitation and other janitorial services for commercial businesses. Downstream industries include aviation, manufacturing, healthcare and entertainment.
key_trends: Barriers to entry remain low since not much is needed to start a cleaning service. New entrants must ensure they have a license and proper equipment to enter the industry.
Buyer power is higher for larger companies that can negotiate rates. These companies require cleaning services periodically, sometimes even daily and enter long-term contracts with cleaners.
Many businesses have an in-house cleaning staff
Despite the closure of many downstream markets, the pandemic bolstered the need for cleaning services
Technology continues to be a focal point for cleaning services
To protect clients and employees, commercial cleaning and sanitation services must adhere to health and safety regulations
Services can receive assistance through various government agencies
Profitability remains consistent for most cleaning services
While automation remains popular among many cleaning services, it has not impacted wages
Commercial offices have rebounded as a source of revenue for cleaning and sanitation services
Healthcare facility cleaning remains crucial to prevent diseases.

market_segmentation.segment: COMMERCIAL PROPERTIES NEED TO LOOK GOOD FOR BOTH EMPLOYEES AND CUSTOMERS
market_segmentation.segment_description: Commercial buildings include office buildings, retail space and warehouses. Most commercial building cleanings are done during or slightly after office hours. These buildings and storefronts often undergo daily cleaning to ensure the property is presentable for employees, customers and clients.

market_segmentation.segment: SANITARY PROTOCOLS ARE A MUST FOR THE INDUSTRIAL SECTOR
market_segmentation.segment_description: The manufacturing and industrial sectors must adhere to regulations regarding cleanliness to uphold workers' safety and a proper work environment. Clean workspaces reduce the risk of accidents, injuries and exposure to harmful substances. Constant cleaning maintenance can also prevent

market_segmentation.segment: MAINTAINING CLEANLINESS CAN HELP PREVENT SICKNESS AMID HEALTHCARE FACILITIES
market_segmentation.segment_description: Healthcare facilities include hospitals, clinics, labs and other practices. These facilities are subject to strict regulations and can risk closure if standards are unmet. With the constant flow of sick individuals, it is important to ensure the entire property is cleaned correctly to prevent the spread of any diseases. Cleanliness also helps prevent any germs from spreading on equipment.

market_segmentation.segment: ENTERTAINMENT VENUES CAN BE A SUPERSPREADER FOR GERMS
market_segmentation.segment_description: Entertainment venues include music halls, stadiums and theaters. A clean and well-maintained venue contributes to a positive guest experience and brings people back. Most of these venues also serve food and must be cleaned appropriately to reduce the risk of viruses. These venues constantly have customers going in and out. Constant cleaning of walls, floors, handrails and seats is done to reduce the spread of germs.

products_and_services.product_description: General Purpose Commercial Cleaning is Back on Track
Healthcare and Laboratory Cleaning Remain Essential

Exterior cleaning for commercial cleaning services involves the cleaning and maintaining external surfaces, including walls, sidewalks and roofs. Mold, dirt and other contaminants can gather over time on a property and companies will rely on cleaning services to periodically remove them.

Damage restoration in the context of commercial cleaning services refers to the process of cleaning, repairing and restoring a commercial property. This service is often needed after events like water damage, fire damage, infestations or other events that can severely harm property. This segment only generates a small portion of revenue as these events do not occur frequently

tier_1_suppliers: Janitorial Equipment Supply Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Sanitary Paper Product Manufacturing in the US
Soap & Cleaning Compound Manufacturing in the US
Hand Sanitizer Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: This driver refers to corporate profit earned across all industries. As corporate profit increases for downstream businesses, they become more likely to expand their use of industries. Similarly, when corporate profit declines, they tend to cut back spending on janitorial services, posing a potential threat to revenue.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Low requirements to start a cleaning service
barriers_points.barrier_description: Not much is needed to start a cleaning service. New entrants must ensure they have a license and proper equipment to enter the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Buyer power is higher for larger companies that can negotiate rates. These companies require cleaning services periodically, sometimes even daily.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages Remain Elevated Despite Automation Efforts
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages account for the largest portion of industry revenue and have continued to remain high despite cleaning services slowly transitioning into automation.
Profit is directly linked to performance and the need for cleaning services.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Pandemic Induces Volatility Among Clients
volatility_points.volatility_description: The pandemic led to stricter health and safety regulations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Automation and Smart Technology Provide a Boost
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Many cleaning services are using robotic cleaners to help with tasks.

FAQs.question: Revenue Volatility
FAQs.answer: The pandemic induced volatility among clients.

FAQs.question: Regulation & Policy
FAQs.answer: Low steady regulation in the industry.

FAQs.question: Industry Assistance
FAQs.answer: No industry assistance. Steady assistance level.
